poem:
Mass Murder in Fall City

In the still gray  
of a Seattle dawn,  
a house sits quiet—  
breathless with absence.  
  
Five hearts once  
beat warm within,  
now hushed echoes.  
A boy—youth muddied  
by rage—paints  
walls with sorrow.  
  
Silence thickens,  
another tally carved  
in the cold wood  
of this nation.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Five family members shot to death in home outside Seattle Authorities found five people shot to death inside a home south-east of Seattle on Monday morning and arrested a teenager in connection with the killings, police said. The killings in Fall City, Washington, were the 25th mass murder in the US so far this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive. The nonpartisan archive defines a mass murder as one in which four or more". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
